intro: Peponia urticoides, commonly known as the stinging nettle vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, often stinging leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squashes. Its stems are usually trailing or climbing, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The leaves contain irritants that can cause skin irritation upon contact.
